quinidine ] [ quinine ] [ ranitidine ]  [ salicylates ] [ sulfinpyrazone ] [ sulfonamides ]  long acting [ sulindac ] [ thyroid drugs ] [ tolbutamide ] [ triclofos sodium ] [ trimethoprim ] [ sulfamethoxazole ] unreliable prothrombin time determinations [ warfarin sodium ] overdosage  [SEP][CLS] oral [ anticoagulants ] may potentiate the hypoglycemic action of [ hypoglycemic agents ]  eg  [ tolbutamide ] and [ chlorpropamide ]  by inhibiting their metabolism in the liver  [SEP][CLS] because oral [ anticoagulants ] may interfere with the hepatic metabolism of [ phenytoin ]  toxic levels of the [ anticonvulsant ] may occur when an oral [ anticoagulant ] and [ phenytoin ] are administered concurrently  [SEP][CLS] drugs that reduce the number of blood platelets by causing bone marrow depression  such as [ antineoplastic agents ]  or drugs which inhibit platelet function  eg  [ aspirin ] and other [ non steroidal anti inflammatory drugs ]  [ dipyridamole ]  [ hydrochloroquine ]  [ clofibrate ]  [ dextran ]  may increase the bleeding tendency produced by [ anticoagulants ] without altering prothrombin time determinations  [SEP][CLS] the beneficial effects on arterial thrombus formation from combined therapy with [ antiplatelet medication ] and [ anticoagulant medication ] must be weighed against an increased risk of inducing hemorrhage  [SEP][CLS] drug laboratory test interferences  [ dicumarol ] and [ indanedione anticoagulants ]  including [ anisindione ]  or their metabolites may color alkaline urine red orange  which may interfere with spectrophotometrically determined urinary laboratory tests  [SEP]$ drug_info=={anticoagulants;[0, 3, 94, 98, 110]}{anticoagulant;[1, 6, 7, 9, 33, 39, 101]}{cholestyramine;[2, 18]}{vitamin K;[4, 19]}{Chloral article_seq==227$ sen_num==4$ article_text==[CLS] [ NUMhtNUM antagonists ]  based on reports of profound hypotension and loss of consciousness when [ apomorphine ] was administered with [ ondansetron ]  the concomitant use of [ apomorphine ] with drugs of the [ NUMhtNUM antagonist class ]  including  for example  [ ondansetron ]  [ granisetron ]  [ dolasetron ]  [ palonosetron ]  and [ alosetron ]  is contraindicated   [SEP][CLS] [ antihypertensive medication ] and [ vasodilators ]  the following adverse events were experienced more commonly in patients receiving concomitant [ antihypertensive medications ] or [ vasodilators ]  n   NUM  compared to patients not receiving these concomitant drugs  n   NUM   hypotension NUM  vs NUM   myocardial infarction NUM  vs NUM   serious pneumonia NUM  vs NUM   serious falls NUM  vs NUM   and bone and joint injuries NUM  vs NUM   [SEP][CLS] [ dopamine antagonists ]  since [ apomorphine ] is a [ dopamine agonist ]  it is possible that [ dopamine antagonists ]  such as the [ neuroleptics ]  [ phenothiazines ]  [ butyrophenones ]  [ thioxanthenes ]  or [ metoclopramide ]  may diminish the effectiveness of [ apokyn ]  [SEP][CLS] patients with major psychotic disorders  treated with [ neuroleptics ]  should be treated with [ dopamine agonists ] only if the potential benefits outweigh the risks  [SEP]$ drug_info=={5HT3 article_seq==609$ sen_num==17$ article_text==[CLS] hypotension   patients on [ diuretic ] therapy  patients on [ diuretics ] and especially those in whom [ diuretic ] therapy was recently instituted  as well as those on severe dietary salt restriction or dialysis  may occasionally experience a precipitous reduction of blood pressure usually within the first hour after receiving the initial dose of [ captopril ]  [SEP][CLS] the possibility of hypotensive effects with [ captopril ] can be minimized by either discontinuing the [ diuretic ] or increasing the salt intake approximately one week prior to initiation of treatment with [ captopril ]  [ captopril ] tablets  usp  or initiating therapy with small doses  NUM NUM or NUM NUM mg   [SEP][CLS] agents having vasodilator activity  data on the management of angina  or other drugs having vasodilator activity should  if possible  be discontinued before starting [ captopril ]  [SEP][CLS] agents causing renin release [ captopril ] s effect will be augmented by [ antihypertensive agents ] that cause renin release  [SEP][CLS] for example  [ diuretics ]  e g   [ thiazides ]  may activate the renin angiotensin aldosterone system  [SEP][CLS] agents affecting sympathetic activity the sympathetic nervous system may be especially important in supporting blood pressure in patients receiving [ captopril ] alone or with [ diuretics ]  [SEP][CLS] therefore  agents affecting sympathetic activity  e g   [ ganglionic blocking agents ] or [ adrenergic neuron blocking agents ]  should be used with caution  [SEP][CLS] [ beta adrenergic blocking drugs ] add some further antihypertensive effect to [ captopril ]  but the overall response is less than additive  [SEP][CLS] [ potassium sparing diuretics ] such as [ spironolactone ]  [ triamterene ]  or [ amiloride ]  or [ potassium ] supplements should be given only for documented hypokalemia  and then with caution  since they may lead to a significant increase of serum potassium generally should not be given with [ diuretics ]  [SEP][CLS] [ diuretic agents ] reduce the renal clearance of [ lithium ] and add a high risk of [ lithium ] toxicity  [SEP][CLS] refer to the package insert for [ lithium ] preparations before use of such preparations with [ chlorothiazide ] [SEP][CLS]   [ non steroidal anti inflammatory drugs ]  in some patients  the administration of a [ non steroidal anti inflammatory agent ] can reduce the diuretic  natriuretic  and antihypertensive effects of [ loop diuretics ]  [ potassium sparing diuretics ] and [ thiazide diuretics ]  [SEP][CLS] therefore  when [ chlorothiazide ] and [ non steroidal anti inflammatory agents ] are used concomitantly  the patient should be observed closely to determine if the desired effect of the [ diuretic ] is obtained [SEP]$ drug_info=={Alcohol;[0]}{barbiturates;[1]}{narcotics;[2]}{Antidiabetic drugs;[3]}{insulin;[4]}{antidiabetic drug;[5]}{Cholestyramine;[6]}{colestipol;[7, 10]}{resins;[8, of [ propranolol ] absorption  but had a small yet statistically significant effect on its rate of absorption  [SEP][CLS] therefore  patients on [ propranolol ] should be observed when [ colestid ] juices  etc   lower absorption of [ amphetamines ]  [SEP][CLS] [ urinary acidifying agents ]  [ ammonium chloride ]  [ sodium acid phosphate ]  etc   increase the concentration of the ionized species of the [ amphetamine ] molecule  thereby increasing urinary excretion  [SEP][CLS] [ adrenergic blockers ]  [ adrenergic blockers ] are inhibited by [ amphetamines ]  [SEP][CLS] alkalinizing agents concentration of the non ionized species of the [ amphetamine ] molecule  thereby decreasing urinary excretion  [SEP][CLS] [ antidepressants ]  [ tricyclic ]  [ amphetamines ] may enhance the activity article_seq==187$ sen_num==6$ article_text==[CLS] considerable caution should be exercised if [ peganone ] is administered concurrently with [ phenurone ]  [ phenacemide ]  since paranoid symptoms have been reported during therapy with this combination  [SEP][CLS] a two way interaction between the [ hydantoin antiepileptic ]  [ phenytoin ]  and the [ coumarin anticoagulant ] has been suggested  [SEP][CLS] presumably  [ phenytoin ] acts as a stimulator of [ coumarin ] metabolism and has been reported to cause decreased serum levels of the [ coumarin anticoagulants ] and increased prothrombin proconvertin concentrations  [SEP][CLS] conversely  the [ coumarin anticoagulants ] have been reported to increase the serum levels and prolong the serum half life of [ phenytoin ] by inhibiting its metabolism  [SEP][CLS] although there is no documentation of such  a similar interaction between [ ethotoin ] and the [ coumarin anticoagulants ] may occur  [SEP][CLS] caution is therefore advised when administering [ peganone ] to patients receiving [ coumarin anticoagulants ]  [SEP]$ drug_info=={PEGANONE;[0, 13]}{Phenurone;[1]}{phenacemide;[2]}{hydantoin antiepileptic;[3]}{phenytoin;[4, 6, 10]}{coumarin anticoagulant;[5]}{coumarin;[7]}{coumarin anticoagulants;[8, 9, 12, 14]}{ethotoin;[11]}$ pairs_info=={PEGANONE;Phenurone;advise}{PEGANONE;phenacemide;advise}{Phenurone;phenacemide;false}{hydantoin antiepileptic;phenytoin;int}{hydantoin antiepileptic;coumarin anticoagulant;int}{phenytoin;coumarin anticoagulant;false}{phenytoin;coumarin;mechanism}{phenytoin;coumarin anticoagulants;mechanism}{coumarin;coumarin anticoagulants;false}{ethotoin;coumarin anticoagulants;false}{PEGANONE;coumarin anticoagulants;advise}$

article_seq==708$ sen_num==21$ article_text==[CLS] [ ace inhibitors ] reports suggest that [ nsaids ] may diminish the antihypertensive effect of [ ace inhibitors ]  [SEP][CLS] this interaction should be given consideration in patients taking [ nsaids ] concomitantly with [ ace inhibitors ]  [SEP][CLS] [ antacids ]  the concomitant administration of [ antacids ] has no apparent effect on the extent of absorption of [ lodine ]  [SEP][CLS] [ aspirin ]  when [ lodine ] is administered with [ aspirin ]  its protein binding is reduced  although the clearance of free [ etodolac ] is not altered  [SEP][CLS] however  as with other [ nsaids ]  concomitant administration of [ lodine ] and [ aspirin ] is not generally recommended because of the potential of increased adverse effects  [SEP][CLS] cyclosporine  digoxin  methotrexate [ lodine ]  like other [ nsaids ]  through effects on renal prostaglandins  may cause changes in the elimination of these drugs leading to elevated serum levels of [ cyclosporine ]  [ digoxin ]  [ methotrexate ]  and increased toxicity  [SEP][CLS] patients receiving these drugs who are given [ lodine ]  or any other [ nsaid ]  and particularly those patients with altered renal function  should be observed for the development of the specific toxicities of these drugs  [SEP][CLS] [ diuretics ]  etodolac has no apparent pharmacokinetic interaction when administered with [ furosemide ] or [ hydrochlorothiazide ]  [SEP][CLS] nevertheless  clinical studies  as well as postmarketing observations have shown that [ lodine ] can reduce the natriuretic effect of [ furosemide ] and [ thiazides ] in some patients  [SEP][CLS] [ glyburide ]  [ etodolac ] has no apparent pharmacokinetic interaction when administered with [ glyburide ]  [SEP][CLS] [ concurrently  subjects should be observed carefully for signs of [ lithium ] toxicity  [SEP][CLS] [ phenylbutazone ]  [ phenylbutazone ] causes increase  by about NUM   in the free fraction of [ coadministered  [SEP][CLS] [ phenytoin ]  [ etodolac ] has no apparent pharmacokinetic interaction when administered with [ phenytoin ]  [SEP][CLS] [ warfarin ]  the effects of [ warfarin ] and [ nsaids ] on gi bleeding are synergistic  such that users of both drugs together have a risk of serious gi bleeding higher than that of users of either drug alone  [SEP][CLS] short term pharmacokinetic studies have demonstrated that concomitant administration of [ warfarin ] and [ lodine ]   [ etodolac ] capsules and tablets  results in reduced protein binding of [ warfarin ]  but there was no change in the clearance of free [ warfarin ]  [SEP][CLS] there was no significant difference in the pharmacodynamic effect of [ warfarin ] administered alone and [ warfarin ] administered with [ lodine ] as measured by prothrombin time  [SEP][CLS] thus  concomitant therapy with [ warfarin ] and [ lodine ] should not require dosage adjustment of either drug  [SEP][CLS] however  caution should article_seq==433$ sen_num==11$ article_text==[CLS] no drugs are known to interfere with the conversion of [ fosphenytoin ] to [ phenytoin ]  [SEP][CLS] conversion could be affected by alterations in concurrently administered in single submaximal doses  [SEP][CLS] the most significant drug interactions following administration of [ cerebyx ] are expected to occur with drugs that interact with [ ] concentrations include  [ carbamazepine ]  chronic [ alcohol ] abuse  [ reserpine ] [SEP][CLS]   drugs that may either increase or decrease plasma [ phenytoin ] concentrations include  [ phenobarbital ]  vaiproic acid  and [ sodium valproate ]  [SEP][CLS] similarly  the effects of [ phenytoin ] on [ phenobarbital ]  [ valproic acid ] and sodium plasma [ valproate ] concentrations are unpredictable [SEP][CLS]   although not a true drug interaction  [ tricyclic antidepressants ] may precipitate seizures in susceptible patients and [ cerebyx ] dosage may need to be adjusted article_seq==418$ sen_num==14$ article_text==[CLS] [ furosemide ] may increase the ototoxic potential of [ aminoglycoside antibiotics ]  especially in the presence of impaired renal function  [SEP][CLS] [ furosemide ] should not be used concomitantly with [ ethacrynic acid ] because of the possibility of ototoxicity  [SEP][CLS] patients receiving high doses of [ salicylates ] concomitantly with [ furosemide ]  as in rheumatic disease  may experience [ salicylate ] toxicity at lower doses because of competitive renal excretory sites  [SEP][CLS] [ furosemide ] has a tendency to antagonize the skeletal muscle relaxing effect of [ tubocurarine ] and may potentiate the action of [ succinylcholine ]  [SEP][CLS] [ lithium ] generally should not be given with [ diuretics ] because they reduce [ lithium ] renal clearance and add a high risk of [ lithium ] toxicity  [SEP][CLS] [ furosemide ] may add to or potentiate the therapeutic effect of other [ antihypertensive drugs ] norepinephrine ]  [SEP][CLS] tablets simultaneous administration of [ sucralfate ] and [ furosemide ] tablets may reduce the natriuretic and antihypertensive effects of [ furosemide ]  [SEP][CLS] the bun  serum creatinine and serum potassium levels  and weight gain when [ furosemide ] was used in conjunction with [ nsaids ]  [SEP][CLS] literature reports indicate that coadministration of [ indomethacin ] may reduce the natriuretic and antihypertensive effects of [ furosemide ] in some patients by inhibiting prostaglandin synthesis  [SEP][CLS] patients receiving both [ indomethacin ] and il;false}{steroid article_seq==569$ sen_num==15$ article_text==[CLS] [ antacids ]  [ sucralfate ]  metal cations  [ multivitamins ] [ quinolones ] form chelates with alkaline earth and transition metal cations article_seq==257$ sen_num==5$ article_text==[CLS] interactions with other cns agents  concurrent use of [ levo dromoran ] with all [ central nervous system depressants ]  eg  [ alcohol ]  [ sedatives ]  [ hypnotics ]  other [ opioids ]  general [ anesthetics ]  [ barbiturates ]  [ tricyclic antidepressants ]  [ phenothiazines ]  [ tranquilizers ]  [ skeletal muscle relaxants ] and [ antihistamines ]  may result in additive central nervous system depressant effects  [SEP][CLS] although no interaction between [ mao inhibitors ] and [ levo dromoran ] has been observed  it is not recommended for use with [ mao inhibitors ]  [SEP][CLS] most cases of serious or fatal adverse events involving [ levo dromoran ] reported to the manufacturer or the fda have involved either the administration of large initial doses or too frequent doses of the drug to nonopioid tolerant patients  or the simultaneous administration of [ levorphanol ] with other drugs affecting respiration  [SEP][CLS] interactions with [ mixed agonist antagonist opioid analgesics ]  [ agonist antagonist analgesics ]  eg  [ pentazocine ]  [ nalbuphine ]  [ butorphanol ]  [ dezocine ] and [ buprenorphine ]  should not be administered to a patient who has received or is receiving a course of therapy with a [ pure agonist opioid analgesic ] such as [ levo dromoran ]  [SEP][CLS] in [ opioid ] dependent patients  [ occasionally experience an excessive reduction of blood pressure after initiation of therapy with [ prinivil ]  [SEP][CLS] the possibility of hypotensive effects with [ prinivil ] can be minimized by article_seq==874$ sen_num==25$ article_text==[CLS] in evaluating the potential for interactions among co administered antiepilepsy drugs  [ aeds ]   whether or not an [ aed ] induces or does not induce metabolic enzymes is an important consideration  [SEP][CLS] [ phenytoin ]  [ phenobarbital ] and [ carbamazepine ] are ge nerally classified as enzyme inducers  [SEP][CLS] [ valproate ] and [ gabapentin ] are not  [SEP][CLS] [ gabitril ] is considered to be a non enzyme inducing [ aed ]  [SEP][CLS] effects of [ gabitril ] on other antiepilepsy drugs  [ aeds ]    [ phenytoin ]  [ tiagabine ] had no effect on the steady state plasma concentrations of [ phenytoin ] in patients with epilepsy  [SEP][CLS] [ carbamazepine ]  [ tiagabine ] had no effect on the steady state plasma concentrations of [ carbamazepine ] or its epoxide metabolite in patients with epilepsy  [SEP][CLS] [ valproate ]  [ tiagabine ] causes a slight decrease  about NUM   in steady state [ valproate ] concentrations  [SEP][CLS] [ phenobarbital ] or [ primidone ]   no formal pharmacokinetic studies have been performed examining the addition of [ tiagabine ] to regimens containing [ phenobarbital ] or [ primidone ]  [SEP][CLS] the addition of [ tiagabine ] in a limited number of patients in three well controlled studies caused no systematic changes in [ phenobarbital ] or [ primidone ] concentrations when compared to placebo  [SEP][CLS] effects of other antiepilepsy drugs  [ aeds ]  on [ gabitril ]   [ carbamazepine ]  population pharmacokinetic analyses indicate that [ tiagabine ] clearance is NUM  greater in patients taking [ carbamazepine ] with or without other enzyme  inducing [ aeds ]  [SEP][CLS] [ phenytoin ]  population pharmacokinetic analyses indicate that [ tiagabine article_seq==1462$ sen_num==41$ article_text==[CLS] the drug interaction studies with [ valdecoxib ] were performed both with [ valdecoxib ] and a rapidly hydrolyzed intravenous prodrug form  [SEP][CLS] [ aspirin ]  concomitant administration of [ aspirin ] with [ valdecoxib ] may result in an increased risk of gi ulceration and complications compared to [ valdecoxib ] alone  [SEP][CLS] because of its lack of anti platelet effect [ valdecoxib ] is not a substitute for [ aspirin ] for cardiovascular prophylaxis  [SEP][CLS] in a parallel group drug interaction study comparing the intravenous prodrug form of [ valdecoxib ] at NUM mg bid  n NUM  vs placebo  n NUM   [ valdecoxib ] had no effect on in vitro [ aspirin ] mediated inhibition of arachidonate  or collagen stimulated platelet aggregation  [SEP][CLS] [ methotrexate ]  [ valdecoxib NUM mg ] bid did not show a significant effect on the plasma exposure or renal clearance of [ methotrexate ]  [SEP][CLS] [ ace inhibitors ] reports suggest that [ nsaids ] may diminish the antihypertensive effect of [ ace inhibitors ]  [SEP][CLS] this interaction should be given consideration in patients taking [ bextra ] concomitantly with [ ace inhibitors ]  [SEP][CLS] [ furosemide ]  clinical studies  as well as post marketing observations  have shown that [ nsaids ] can reduce the natriuretic effect of [ furosemide ] and [ thiazides ] in some patients  [SEP][CLS] [ anticonvulsants ]  [ phenytoin ]   steady state plasma exposure  auc  of [ valdecoxib ]  NUM mg bid for NUM days  was decreased by NUM  when co administered with multiple doses  NUM mg qd for NUM days  of [ phenytoin ]  a cyp NUMaNUM inducer   [SEP][CLS] patients already stabilized on [ valdecoxib ] should be closely monitored for loss of symptom control with [ phenytoin ] coadministration  [SEP][CLS] [ valdecoxib ] did not have a statistically significant effect on the pharmacokinetics of [ phenytoin ]  a cyp NUMcNUM and cyp NUMcNUM substrate   [SEP][CLS] [ dextromethorphan ]  [ dextromethorphan ] is primarily metabolized by cyp NUMdNUM and to a lesser extent by NUMaNUM  [SEP][CLS] coadministration with [ valdecoxib ]  NUM mg bid after [ ethanol ] administration  [SEP][CLS] [ zaleplon ] did not affect the pharmacokinetics of [ ethanol ]  [SEP][CLS] [ imipramine ]  coadministration of single doses of [ sonata ] NUM mg and [ imipramine ] NUM mg produced additive effects on decreased alertness and impaired psychomotor performance for NUM to NUM hours after administration  [SEP][CLS] [ paroxetine ]  coadministration of a single dose of [ sonata ] NUM mg and [ paroxetine ] NUM mg daily for NUM days did not produce any interaction on psychomotor performance  [SEP][CLS] additionally  [ paroxetine ] did not alter the pharmacokinetics of [ sonata ]  reflecting the absence of a role of cypNUMdNUM in [ zaleplon ] s metabolism  [SEP][CLS] [ thioridazine ]  coadministration of single doses of [ sonata ] NUM mg and [ thioridazine ] NUM mg produced additive effects on decreased alertness and impaired psychomotor performance for NUM to NUM hours after administration  [SEP][CLS] [ venlafaxine ]  coadministration of a venlafaxine ]  [SEP][CLS] in addition  there was no pharmacodynamic interaction as a result of coadministration of [ zaleplon ] and [ venlafaxine ] er  [SEP][CLS] [ promethazine ]  coadministration of a single dose of [ zaleplon ] and [ promethazine ]  NUM and NUM mg  respectively  resulted in a NUM  decrease in maximal plasma concentrations of [ zaleplon ]  but no change in the area under the plasma concentration time curve  [SEP][CLS] however  the pharmacodynamics of coadministration of [ zaleplon ] and [ promethazine ] have not been evaluated  [SEP][CLS] drugs that induce cypNUMaNUM [ rifampin ]  cypNUMaNUM is ordinarily a minor metabolizing enzyme of [ zaleplon ]  [SEP][CLS] multiple dose administration of the potent cypNUMaNUM inducer [ rifampin ]  NUM mg every NUM hours  qNUMh  for NUM days   however  reduced [ zaleplon ] cmax and auc by approximately NUM   [SEP][CLS] an alternative non cypNUMaNUM substrate [ hypnotic agent ] may be considered in patients taking cypNUMaNUM inducers such as [ rifampin ]  [ phenytoin ]  [ carbamazepine ]  and [ phenobarbital ]  [SEP][CLS] drugs that inhibit cypNUMaNUM cypNUMaNUM is a minor metabolic pathway for the elimination of [ zaleplon ] because the sum of desethylzaleplon  formed via cypNUMaNUM in vitro  and its metabolites  [ NUM oxo desethylzaleplon ] and [ NUM oxo desethylzaleplon glucuronide ]  account for only NUM  of the urinary recovery of a [ zaleplon ] dose  [SEP][CLS] coadministration of single  oral doses of [ zaleplon ] with [ erythromycin ]  NUM mg and NUM mg  respectively   a strong  selective cypNUMaNUM inhibitor produced a NUM  increase in [ zaleplon ] maximal plasma concentrations and a NUM  increase in the area under the plasma concentration time curve  [SEP][CLS] other strong selective cypNUMaNUM inhibitors such as [ ketoconazole ] can also be expected to increase the exposure of [ zaleplon ]  [SEP][CLS] [ diphenhydramine ]  [ diphenhydramine ] is reported to be a weak inhibitor of aldehyde oxidase in rat liver  but its inhibitory effects in human liver are not known  [SEP][CLS] there is no pharmacokinetic interaction between [ zaleplon ] and [ diphenhydramine ] following the administration of a single dose  NUM mg and NUM mg  respectively  of each drug  [SEP][CLS] drugs that inhibit both aldehyde oxidase and cypNUMaNUM [ cimetidine ]  [ cimetidine ] inhibits both aldehyde oxidase  in vitro  and cypNUMaNUM  in vitro and in vivo   the primary and secondary enzymes  respectively  responsible for [ zaleplon ] metabolism  [SEP][CLS] concomitant administration of [ sonata ]  NUM mg  and [ cimetidine ]  NUM mg  produced an NUM  increase in the mean cmax and auc of [ zaleplon ]  [SEP][CLS] drugs with a narrow therapeutic index [ digoxin ]  [ sonata ]  NUM mg  did not affect ibuprofen ]  [ ibuprofen ] is known to affect renal function and  consequently  alter the renal excretion of other drugs  [SEP][CLS] there was no apparent pharmacokinetic interaction between [ zaleplon ] and [ ibuprofen ] following single dose administration  NUM mg and NUM mg  respectively  of each drug  [SEP][CLS] this was expected because [ zaleplon ] is primarily metabolized and renal
